data.name: Real Equity Credit Facility
data.description: A variable rate credit facility which is secured against your home. It gives you the option to combine loan, savings, and transaction accounts into one package.

features.additionalInfo: You can now check out faster in-store or online using Apple Pay or Google Pay™. Upload your eligible Visa Debit or credit card to the digital wallet and tap away. Mobile payments are a safe and convenient way to pay, especially when you're on the go.

constraints.additionalInfo: Note that the credit limit we give you will depend on your ability to meet your repayments.

eligibility.additionalValue: Must live in Australia and be either: an Australian citizen, an Australian permanent resident or a New Zealand citizen

eligibility.additionalInfo: Credit Approval. Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

fees.name: Settlement Reschedule Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when your discharge settlement is cancelled and/or rescheduled. This fee is payable in either cash or cheque at the time of settlement.

fees.name: Redraw Fee via Branch
fees.additionalInfo: Redraw of advance funds via a Branch.

fees.name: Unclaimed Moneys Administration
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if your account becomes unclaimed due to the application of the Banking Act 1959 and reflects our costs in checking for any known contacts and the search of related accounts. It is debited to your account on closure of account.

fees.name: Valuation and Inspection Fees
fees.additionalInfo: When assessing an application it may be necessary to value a property that is being used as security for the loan. A qualified valuer will be required to complete the valuation. For building loans, inspections may be required at various stage of the build. For all properties the fee will be set by negotiation depending on the particular property. Generally Newcastle Permanent will pay the cost of up to one valuation. However valuation and inspection fees may be payable and the cost is unascertainable

fees.name: Discharge Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we arrange for a discharge of mortgage. There may also be fees charged by a third party.

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when increasing borrowing against an existing security. Also known as a loan top-up.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we or our agents are required to attend settlement to collect deeds or related documents or where there are any additional costs associated with settlement (for example, this may include an agents fee or  Property Exchange Australia (PEXA) fees).

fees.name: Title Search Fee
fees.additionalInfo: This comprises our external searcher’s fee and the Land and Property Information fees. (If the security involves a Community Scheme, or is outside New South Wales, or is old system title, this fee is unascertainable and may be higher. We may charge you what our solicitors or agents charge us to perform this search).

fees.name: Other Fees and Charges
fees.additionalInfo: Other Fees and Charges: Including Government fees and Charges, Legal Fees, Lender's Mortgage Insurance.

fees.name: Card Replacement Overseas
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for each replacement Visa debit card you request whilst overseas and is payable on request. You must have sufficient cleared funds available in your account to cover the cost of the card otherwise it will not be issued.

fees.name: Document and Miscellaneous Service
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request copies of documents such as withdrawal slips or statements, you ask us to verify a transaction on your account or you request any other information. It is calculated on an hourly basis, and charged to your account on a pro-rata basis (subject to minimum charges applying) after the search is undertaken.

fees.name: Dishonour (Direct Debit and Cheque)
fees.additionalInfo: If you ask us to take a payment, either direct debit or salary deduction and you do not have enough funds in your account to cover this payment, you will be charged a fee.

fees.name: Consent Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we agree to a change relating to the title of the property.

fees.name: Financial Institution Cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies at the time you draw a financial institution cheque. It accrues during the month, is debited to your account on the last day of the month and is charged to your account after close of business on the last day of the month.

fees.name: Visa Cash Advance
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for cash withdrawals performed by using a Visa debit card at some foreign ATMs (when pressing the credit button) or for cash withdrawals at overseas ATMs. It also applies for cash advances made over the counter at other financial institutions. It is debited to your account at the time of each transaction. In addition, you may be charged a fee by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. Any fee charged should be advised by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. It will be charged to your account at the time of the transaction and be included in the total cash advance amount printed on your statement.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 2
fees.additionalInfo: Where more than one repayment is in default (the fee will be charged the month the payment is due and each later month until the month after you pay the amount).

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee NPBS Cheque only
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to issue Financial Institution Cheques for settlement. Financial Institution Cheque means a cheque which is issued by us and drawn on us. Where the settlement cheque is drawn by a third party, the fee charged to us by the third party will be passed on to you. The amount of these third party fees may vary and are unascertainable as at the date of these terms and conditions.

fees.name: Financial Institution Cheque Replacement
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request us to replace a lost/stolen/destroyed financial institution cheque we have drawn on your behalf. It applies for each replacement cheque and is payable on request.

fees.name: International Transfer Inward
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for the conversion of international transfers in a foreign currency to Australian dollars.

fees.name: Electronic Transfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to electronically transfer money for settlement.

fees.name: Dormant Account Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you do not generate a transaction on your account for a period of 24 months. This fee is debited to your account approximately every 6 months while it remains dormant.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 1
fees.additionalInfo: Where one payment or less is in arrears at the end of the month.

fees.name: Foreign Currency Conversion
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies when you use your Visa debit card to perform a transaction overseas or where a merchant processes the payment overseas. It is calculated as a percentage of the total transaction amount and is included in the total amount debited to your account.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Establishing a loan is an involved process and requires the expertise of trained staff to assess the loan application, create detailed documentation, coordinate settlement and register the mortgage.

fees.name: Adminstration Fee - Ongoing account keeping fees
fees.additionalInfo: Ongoing account keeping fees

fees.name: Substitution in Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Security listed on a mortgage is changed.

fees.name: Redraw Fee via Internet Banking
fees.additionalInfo: Redraw of advance funds via a Internet Banking or the mobile app.
